Title: exp
Description: Returns exe^{x}ex, where x is the given argument to the function.

Title: log
Description: Returns the natural logarithm of the argument.

Title: exp2
Description: Returns 2 to the power of the given argument

Title: intExp2
Description: Like exp but returns a UInt64.

Title: log2
Description: Returns the binary logarithm of the argument.

Title: exp10
Description: Returns 10 to the power of the given argument.

Title: intExp10
Description: Like exp10 but returns a UInt64.

Title: log10
Description: Returns the decimal logarithm of the argument.

Title: sqrt
Description: Returns the square root of the argument.

Title: cbrt
Description: Returns the cubic root of the argument.

Title: erf
Description: If x is non-negative, then erf(xσ2)erf(\frac{x}{\sigma\sqrt{2}})erf(σ2x) is the probability that a random variable having a normal distribution with standard deviation σ\sigmaσ takes the value that is separated from the expected value by more than x.

Title: erfc
Description: Returns a number close to 1−erf(x)1-erf(x)1−erf(x) without loss of precision for large x values.

Title: lgamma
Description: Returns the logarithm of the gamma function.

Title: sin
Description: Returns the sine of the argument

Title: cos
Description: Returns the cosine of the argument.

Title: tan
Description: Returns the tangent of the argument.

Title: asin
Description: Returns the arc sine of the argument.

Title: acos
Description: Returns the arc cosine of the argument.

Title: atan
Description: Returns the arc tangent of the argument.

Title: pow
Description: x - (U)Int8/16/32/64, Float* or Decimal*y - (U)Int8/16/32/64, Float* or Decimal*

Title: cosh
Description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of the argument.
x — The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: −∞<x<+∞-\infty \lt x \lt +\infty−∞<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: acosh
Description: x — Hyperbolic cosine of angle. Values from the interval: 1≤x<+∞1 \le x \lt +\infty1≤x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: 0≤acosh(x)<+∞0 \le acosh(x) \lt +\infty0≤acosh(x)<+∞.

Title: sinh
Description: x — The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: −∞<x<+∞-\infty \lt x \lt +\infty−∞<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: asinh
Description: x — Hyperbolic sine of angle. Values from the interval: −∞<x<+∞-\infty \lt x \lt +\infty−∞<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: −∞<asinh(x)<+∞-\infty \lt asinh(x) \lt +\infty−∞<asinh(x)<+∞.

Title: tanh
Description: x — The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: −∞<x<+∞-\infty \lt x \lt +\infty−∞<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: atanh
Description: x — Hyperbolic tangent of angle. Values from the interval: −1<x<1-1 \lt x \lt 1−1<x<1. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
The angle, in radians. Values from the interval: −∞<atanh(x)<+∞-\infty \lt atanh(x) \lt +\infty−∞<atanh(x)<+∞.

Title: atan2
Description: Returns the atan2 as the angle in the Euclidean plane, given in radians, between the positive x axis and the ray to the point (x, y) ≠ (0, 0).
y — y-coordinate of the point through which the ray passes. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.x — x-coordinate of the point through which the ray passes. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
The angle θ such that −π<0≤π-\pi \lt 0 \le \pi−π<0≤π, in radians.

Title: hypot
Description: Returns the length of the hypotenuse of a right-angle triangle. Hypot avoids problems that occur when squaring very large or very small numbers.
x — The first cathetus of a right-angle triangle. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.y — The second cathetus of a right-angle triangle. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
The length of the hypotenuse of a right-angle triangle.

Title: log1p
Description: Calculates log(1+x). The calculation log1p(x) is more accurate than log(1+x) for small values of x.
x — Values from the interval: −1<x<+∞-1 \lt x \lt +\infty−1<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: sign
Description: Returns the sign of a real number.
x — Values from −∞-\infty−∞ to +∞+\infty+∞. Supports all numeric types in ClickHouse.
-1 for x < 00 for x = 01 for x > 0

Title: sigmoid
Description: x — input value. Values from the interval: −∞<x<+∞-\infty \lt x \lt +\infty−∞<x<+∞. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.
Corresponding value along the sigmoid curve between 0 and 1. Float64.
Examples: SELECT round(sigmoid(x), 5) FROM (SELECT arrayJoin([-1, 0, 1]) AS x);

Title: degrees
Description: x — Input in radians. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.x — Input in radians. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: radians
Description: x — Input in degrees. (U)Int*, Float* or Decimal*.

Title: factorial
Description: Computes the factorial of an integer value. Works with any native integer type including UInt(8|16|32|64) and Int(8|16|32|64). The return type is UInt64.

The factorial of 0 is 1. Likewise, the factorial() function returns 1 for any negative value. The maximum positive value for the input argument is 20, a value of 21 or greater will cause exception throw.

Title: width_bucket
Description: Returns the number of the bucket in which operand falls in a histogram having count equal-width buckets spanning the range low to high. Returns 0 if operand < low, and returns count+1 if operand >= high.
operand, low, high can be any native number type. count can only be unsigned native integer and its value cannot be zero.

Title: proportionsZTest
Feature: proportionsZTest(successes_x, successes_y, trials_x, trials_y, conf_level, pool_type)
Description: Returns test statistics for the two proportion Z-test - a statistical test for comparing the proportions from two populations x and y.
proportionsZTest(successes_x, successes_y, trials_x, trials_y, conf_level, pool_type)

successes_x: Number of successes in population x. UInt64.successes_y: Number of successes in population y. UInt64.trials_x: Number of trials in population x. UInt64.trials_y: Number of trials in population y. UInt64.conf_level: Confidence level for the test. Float64.pool_type: Selection of pooling (way in which the standard error is estimated). Can be either unpooled or pooled. String.

NoteFor argument pool_type: In the pooled version, the two proportions are averaged, and only one proportion is used to estimate the standard error. In the unpooled version, the two proportions are used separately.
z_stat: Z statistic. Float64.p_val: P value. Float64.ci_low: The lower confidence interval. Float64.ci_high: The upper confidence interval. Float64.
